磷脂雙層嗰題寫咗蛋白質可以過載體蛋白，最後五秒見到想改改唔切，想哭了
有夠智障

E1 FYR
1a(i)
135-140 sodium conc., healthy ADH unchanged
135 – 145 disordered unchanged
Healthy, from 140 onward to 155, ADH increase sharply when sodium increase
Disordered, from 145 onward, increases slowly

(ii)
Before 140 [Na+] the same.
After 140 [Na+], healthy produces less urine when higher sodium when compared with disordered.
Because more ADH causes larger proportion of water being reabsorbed inside collecting duct.

(iii)
[Na+] in blood increase causes water potential of blood decreases.
The osmoregulatory center in hypothalamus detects the drop of water potential of blood,
It stimulates the pituitary glands to release more ADH.

(iv)
Disorder may lead to pituitary unable to release FSH.
Without FSH stimulation, ovarian follicles cannot be developed, and it cannot release sufficient amount of estrogen.
Estrogen is used for stimulation of uterine lining thickening.
Thus, when there is no uterine lining thickening, there may not be menstruation.
(One possible explanation)

1b(i)
In lower CO2 conc (0.04-3.5%), breathing depth.
In higher (3.5-6.5%), breathing rate.

(ii)
This is the maximum volume of air can be taken in by lung.

(iii)
CO2 increases, the rate increases.
The amount of increase is more, when the CO2 conc. Is higher. (not necessary, I think)
(iv)
CO2 in blood increase, pH of blood decrease.
Chemoreceptors in medulla oblongata, carotid and aortic bodies detects the drop of pH.
Sends nerve signal to respiratory center in medulla oblongata.
The center sends more signals to diaphragm and intercostal muscle, which causes the muscles to contract faster and stronger.
This leads to the increase of ventilation rate.

quote.msg:
E1 FYR
1a(i)
135-140 sodium conc., healthy ADH unchanged
135 – 145 disordered unchanged
Healthy, from 140 onward to 155, ADH increase sharply when sodium increase
Disordered, from 145 onward, increases slowly

(ii)
Before 140 [Na+] the same.
After 140 [Na+], healthy produces less urine when higher sodium when compared with disordered.
Because more ADH causes larger proportion of water being reabsorbed inside collecting duct.

(iii)
[Na+] in blood increase causes water potential of blood decreases.
The osmoregulatory center in hypothalamus detects the drop of water potential of blood,
It stimulates the pituitary glands to release more ADH.

(iv)
Disorder may lead to pituitary unable to release FSH.
Without FSH stimulation, ovarian follicles cannot be developed, and it cannot release sufficient amount of estrogen.
Estrogen is used for stimulation of uterine lining thickening.
Thus, when there is no uterine lining thickening, there may not be menstruation.
(One possible explanation)

1b(i)
In lower CO2 conc (0.04-3.5%), breathing depth.
In higher (3.5-6.5%), breathing rate.

(ii)
This is the maximum volume of air can be taken in by lung.

(iii)
CO2 increases, the rate increases.
The amount of increase is more, when the CO2 conc. Is higher. (not necessary, I think)
(iv)
CO2 in blood increase, pH of blood decrease.
Chemoreceptors in medulla oblongata, carotid and aortic bodies detects the drop of pH.
Sends nerve signal to respiratory center in medulla oblongata.
The center sends more signals to diaphragm and intercostal muscle, which causes the muscles to contract faster and stronger.
This leads to the increase of ventilation rate.

It stimulates the pituitary glands to release more ADH.

(iv)
Disorder may lead to pituitary unable to release FSH.
Without FSH stimulation, ovarian follicles cannot be developed, and it cannot release sufficient amount of estrogen.
Estrogen is used for stimulation of uterine lining thickening.
Thus, when there is no uterine lining thickening, there may not be menstruation.
(One possible explanation)

1b(i)
In lower CO2 conc (0.04-3.5%), breathing depth.
In higher (3.5-6.5%), breathing rate.

(ii)
This is the maximum volume of air can be taken in by lung.

(iii)
CO2 increases, the rate increases.
The amount of increase is more, when the CO2 conc. Is higher. (not necessary, I think)
(iv)
CO2 in blood increase, pH of blood decrease.
Chemoreceptors in medulla oblongata, carotid and aortic bodies detects the drop of pH.
Sends nerve signal to respiratory center in medulla oblongata.
The center sends more signals to diaphragm and intercostal muscle, which causes the muscles to contract faster and stronger.
This leads to the increase of ventilation rate.

Continuous variation
In continuous variation there is a complete range of measurements from one extreme to the other. Height is an example of continuous variation - individuals can have a complete range of heights, for example, 1.6, 1.61, 1.62, 1.625 etc metres high.

replies.msg:
AUG CUG (coding = mRNA sequence)
Met Val Val Tyr Ala Thr

Substitution

Different DNA, different mRNA after transcription Different mRNA = different codon
Different codon result in different tRNA with a complementary anticodon recruited to the ribosome to carry out translation
Since different tRNA may carry different amino acid, it eventually cause the polypeptide chain formed in translation may contain a different amino acid from the original.
Therefore, the difference in amino acid may cause the polypeptide chain to fold and coil into a different 3-D structure and affects the function of the protein （因為唔知佢捉咩key words, 所以詳細左)

Allele 1 is recessive.
Base on homozygous of allele 1 is green, and having both allele 1 and allele 2 is brown.
Since in heterozygous condition (some brown body has both allele 1 and allele 2),
Only dominant allele’s phenotype will be expressed (brown),

quote.msg:
Continuous variation
In continuous variation there is a complete range of measurements from one extreme to the other. Height is an example of continuous variation - individuals can have a complete range of heights, for example, 1.6, 1.61, 1.62, 1.625 etc metres high.

This is the A-level biology definition
Be noted that continuous must show “complete” range of value
E.g. when there is no intermediate between tall and short you cannot call it “continuous variation”
But only the tall/short display a range of continuous spectrum

quote.msg:
E1 FYR
1a(i)
135-140 sodium conc., healthy ADH unchanged
135 – 145 disordered unchanged
Healthy, from 140 onward to 155, ADH increase sharply when sodium increase
Disordered, from 145 onward, increases slowly

(ii)
Before 140 [Na+] the same.
After 140 [Na+], healthy produces less urine when higher sodium when compared with disordered.
Because more ADH causes larger proportion of water being reabsorbed inside collecting duct.

(iii)
[Na+] in blood increase causes water potential of blood decreases.
The osmoregulatory center in hypothalamus detects the drop of water potential of blood,
It stimulates the pituitary glands to release more ADH.

(iv)
Disorder may lead to pituitary unable to release FSH.
Without FSH stimulation, ovarian follicles cannot be developed, and it cannot release sufficient amount of estrogen.
Estrogen is used for stimulation of uterine lining thickening.
Thus, when there is no uterine lining thickening, there may not be menstruation.
(One possible explanation)

1b(i)
In lower CO2 conc (0.04-3.5%), breathing depth.
In higher (3.5-6.5%), breathing rate.

(ii)
This is the maximum volume of air can be taken in by lung.

(iii)
CO2 increases, the rate increases.
The amount of increase is more, when the CO2 conc. Is higher. (not necessary, I think)
(iv)
CO2 in blood increase, pH of blood decrease.
Chemoreceptors in medulla oblongata, carotid and aortic bodies detects the drop of pH.
Sends nerve signal to respiratory center in medulla oblongata.
The center sends more signals to diaphragm and intercostal muscle, which causes the muscles to contract faster and stronger.
This leads to the increase of ventilation rate.

replies.msg:
E1 is actually a case of Central( Cranial ) Diabetes Inspidius with amenorrhoea, which might be
- prolactinoma compressing posterior pituiary gland/pituiary stalk in which amenorrhoea is due to {{{{ hyperprolactinemia }}}}

- pan-hypopituitarism due to hypophysitis( inflammation ) / non-functioning pituitary adenoma / surgery / trauma / ischaemia ( eg Sheehan syndrome ) etc pituitary pathologies, in which amenorrhoea is due to {{{{ FSH/LH deficiency }}}}}


For E4, it is a question to salute Prof. DENNIS Lo from Faculty of Medicine, CUHK for his efforts in putting forward cell-free foetal DNA( cfDNAs ) in application of Non-Invasive Prenatal Test ( NIPT ).

The question can be a difficult one as 95% of Down syndrome is Trisomy 21,~5% is Translocation Down Syndrome and a few are Mosaic Down Syndrome. Obviously, for the later 2 etiologies, there would not be increase in gene from Chromosome 21. I am quite interested how HKEAA is going to deal with this limitation.

E2 question on treating HFMD with antibiotics is kind of tricky, i wonder if DSE students are taught that HFMD is a viral disease indeed. By the way, there are actually no effective, specific antiviral for HFMD, which is caused by a wide range of viruses apart from the most common Coxsackievirus A6.

quote.msg:
E1 FYR
1a(i)
135-140 sodium conc., healthy ADH unchanged
135 – 145 disordered unchanged
Healthy, from 140 onward to 155, ADH increase sharply when sodium increase
Disordered, from 145 onward, increases slowly

(ii)
Before 140 [Na+] the same.
After 140 [Na+], healthy produces less urine when higher sodium when compared with disordered.
Because more ADH causes larger proportion of water being reabsorbed inside collecting duct.

(iii)
[Na+] in blood increase causes water potential of blood decreases.
The osmoregulatory center in hypothalamus detects the drop of water potential of blood,
It stimulates the pituitary glands to release more ADH.

(iv)
Disorder may lead to pituitary unable to release FSH.
Without FSH stimulation, ovarian follicles cannot be developed, and it cannot release sufficient amount of estrogen.
Estrogen is used for stimulation of uterine lining thickening.
Thus, when there is no uterine lining thickening, there may not be menstruation.
(One possible explanation)

1b(i)
In lower CO2 conc (0.04-3.5%), breathing depth.
In higher (3.5-6.5%), breathing rate.

(ii)
This is the maximum volume of air can be taken in by lung.

(iii)
CO2 increases, the rate increases.
The amount of increase is more, when the CO2 conc. Is higher. (not necessary, I think)
(iv)
CO2 in blood increase, pH of blood decrease.
Chemoreceptors in medulla oblongata, carotid and aortic bodies detects the drop of pH.
Sends nerve signal to respiratory center in medulla oblongata.
The center sends more signals to diaphragm and intercostal muscle, which causes the muscles to contract faster and stronger.
This leads to the increase of ventilation rate.

E1 is actually a case of Central( Cranial ) Diabetes Inspidius with amenorrhoea, which might be
- prolactinoma compressing posterior pituiary gland/pituiary stalk in which amenorrhoea is due to {{{{ hyperprolactinemia }}}}

- pan-hypopituitarism due to hypophysitis( inflammation ) / non-functioning pituitary adenoma / surgery / trauma / ischaemia ( eg Sheehan syndrome ) etc pituitary pathologies, in which amenorrhoea is due to {{{{ FSH/LH deficiency }}}}}


For E4, it is a question to salute Prof. DENNIS Lo from Faculty of Medicine, CUHK for his efforts in putting forward cell-free foetal DNA( cfDNAs ) in application of Non-Invasive Prenatal Test ( NIPT ).

The question can be a difficult one as 95% of Down syndrome is Trisomy 21,~5% is Translocation Down Syndrome and a few are Mosaic Down Syndrome. Obviously, for the later 2 etiologies, there would not be increase in gene from Chromosome 21. I am quite interested how HKEAA is going to deal with this limitation.

E2 question on treating HFMD with antibiotics is kind of tricky, i wonder if DSE students are taught that HFMD is a viral disease indeed. By the way, there are actually no effective, specific antiviral for HFMD, which is caused by a wide range of viruses apart from the most common Coxsackievirus A6.

(補充多句，lichen其實可以反映到空氣質素，因為佢對空氣質素嘅改變好敏感)
(ii) sulphur dioxide 同nitrogen oxides，佢地會溶喺雨水到，形成sulphuric acid同nitric acid，降低雨水pH
(iii) 第一，一部分嘅minerals 會溶喺酸雨到然後被leach走 / removed by acid rain，個concentration會低咗
第二，某啲minerals會被release 出黎，例如酸性環境會增加aluminum ions嘅release，，個concentration會高咗

quote.msg:
E1 FYR
1a(i)
135-140 sodium conc., healthy ADH unchanged
135 – 145 disordered unchanged
Healthy, from 140 onward to 155, ADH increase sharply when sodium increase
Disordered, from 145 onward, increases slowly

(ii)
Before 140 [Na+] the same.
After 140 [Na+], healthy produces less urine when higher sodium when compared with disordered.
Because more ADH causes larger proportion of water being reabsorbed inside collecting duct.

(iii)
[Na+] in blood increase causes water potential of blood decreases.
The osmoregulatory center in hypothalamus detects the drop of water potential of blood,
It stimulates the pituitary glands to release more ADH.

(iv)
Disorder may lead to pituitary unable to release FSH.
Without FSH stimulation, ovarian follicles cannot be developed, and it cannot release sufficient amount of estrogen.
Estrogen is used for stimulation of uterine lining thickening.
Thus, when there is no uterine lining thickening, there may not be menstruation.
(One possible explanation)

1b(i)
In lower CO2 conc (0.04-3.5%), breathing depth.
In higher (3.5-6.5%), breathing rate.

(ii)
This is the maximum volume of air can be taken in by lung.

(iii)
CO2 increases, the rate increases.
The amount of increase is more, when the CO2 conc. Is higher. (not necessary, I think)
(iv)
CO2 in blood increase, pH of blood decrease.
Chemoreceptors in medulla oblongata, carotid and aortic bodies detects the drop of pH.
Sends nerve signal to respiratory center in medulla oblongata.
The center sends more signals to diaphragm and intercostal muscle, which causes the muscles to contract faster and stronger.
This leads to the increase of ventilation rate.

E1 is actually a case of Central( Cranial ) Diabetes Inspidius with amenorrhoea, which might be
- prolactinoma compressing posterior pituiary gland/pituiary stalk in which amenorrhoea is due to {{{{ hyperprolactinemia }}}}

- pan-hypopituitarism due to hypophysitis( inflammation ) / non-functioning pituitary adenoma / surgery / trauma / ischaemia ( eg Sheehan syndrome ) etc pituitary pathologies, in which amenorrhoea is due to {{{{ FSH/LH deficiency }}}}}


For E4, it is a question to salute Prof. DENNIS Lo from Faculty of Medicine, CUHK for his efforts in putting forward cell-free foetal DNA( cfDNAs ) in application of Non-Invasive Prenatal Test ( NIPT ).

The question can be a difficult one as 95% of Down syndrome is Trisomy 21,~5% is Translocation Down Syndrome and a few are Mosaic Down Syndrome. Obviously, for the later 2 etiologies, there would not be increase in gene from Chromosome 21. I am quite interested how HKEAA is going to deal with this limitation.

E2 question on treating HFMD with antibiotics is kind of tricky, i wonder if DSE students are taught that HFMD is a viral disease indeed. By the way, there are actually no effective, specific antiviral for HFMD, which is caused by a wide range of viruses apart from the most common Coxsackievirus A6.

replies.msg:
Look at the pituiary stalk, if it is compressed and hence blocked, no ADH can be transported to posterior pituitary lobe for secretion into bloodstream.


Hyperprolactinemia, meaning high plasma prolactin concentration, can be due to
1) Prolactinoma in anterior pituiary lobe
Prolactinoma means a tumor secreting prolactin. Normally, prolactin is secreted by cells in anterior pituiary lobe( lactotroph ). Prolactinoma is a type of tumor comprised of lactotrophs.

2) Disconnection hyperprolactinemia

Dopaminergic neuron from Hypothalmus release dopamine to inhibits secretion of prolactin in pituitary gland. If the pituitary stalk is compressed by a tumor, hypothalmus is then disconnected with pituitary gland and unable to inhibit pituitary prolactin secretion.

Prolactin exerts inhibitory effect on GnRH secretion at Hypothalmus. More prolactin --> less GnRH --> less FSH/LH --> less progesterone/estrogen --> no menstruation

So a prolactinoma/ non-secreting tumor compressing pituitary stalk would both leads to high prolactin( ->no menstruation) & low ADH( large volume of pale urine despite high sodium ion level in blood ) level.
